newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Cheil to build plant in Philippines.
newsitem.headline: Cheil to build plant in Philippines.

text.p: South Korea's Cheiljedang Corp said on Wednesday it broke ground for a $10.5 million joint venture feed milling plant in San Rafael, Philippines.
Cheil said in a statement the plant was expected to have an annual production capacity of 150,000 tonnes of compound feed.
Cheil said it holds a 70 percent stake in the venture while the Philippines' Great Harvest Corp holds 20 percent and Daewoo Corp 10 percent.
The three companies will also set up a subsidiary in the Philippines called "CJ Philippines Co" with a capital of $4.2 million, it said.

Feed demand in the Philippines was expected to rise 13 percent annually to 13 million tonnes in 2000 from current four million tonnes, the statement said. Sales from the plant is expected to reach $50 million in 2000.
Cheil's annual production capacity stands at one million tonnes of compound feed in South Korea and 250,000 tonnes in Indonesia.
